content.text:
# Thuwar al-Sanamayn

| leader           = Walid al-Zahra
| dates            = -20202025-present (remnants)
| country          =
| allegiance       =  Free Syrian Army
| headquarters     = Al-Sanamayn
| area             = Daraa Governorate
| ideology         = Anti-Assadism
| opponents        =  Al-Haymed's group
| war              =
* Syrian Civil War
** Daraa insurgency
*** March 2020 Daraa clashes
}}
Thuwar al-Sanamayn () is a militant organization in Syria.
History
It was founded by Walid al-Zahra  and fought against the Syrian Arab Armed Forces in Al-Sanamayn attacking checkpoints, during March 2020 Daraa clashes where they besieged the city of al-Sanamayn until the Syrian Arab Armed Forces killed Walid al-Zahra.
Thuwar al-Sanamayn attacked Mohsen al-Haymed Al-Haymed's group in 2025, calling them a "criminal gang that desecrated the land of Al-Sanamayn."
